comment: Example provides representation of E. Hovy's Event Complex schema layout for a disease outbreak.
This is the TA2 example.

instances.name: Disease outbreak
instances.description: Event complex for a disease outbreak
instances.comment: Not all of these schemas are implemented here.  schemaInstantiations should be top-level TA1 events only.

events.name: Pathogen progression
events.description: Schema for the progression of a pathogen

privateData.comment: Performers can place any keys/values they wish here.  Large amounts of private data will be stored on S3 and linked via a key in the map.  The intention is to validate the size (in bytes) of the object does not exceed a defined maximum.

participants.comment: Role names are not validated.  You can use roles from the KOWG, the DWD overlay, or UMR non-lexical roles

comment: Semantics of optional is that if it is set to true, then the event is optional.  If it is set to false OR MISSING, the event is mandatory. TA1 systems decide whether an event its optional or not.
Importance is local to a parent's children, and do not need to be consistent across instantiations or performers.
Think of outlinks as the next node (or nodes) in a succession of nodes.

relations.comment: Note that relation triples (with relationPredicates taken from DWD relations) can be defined in any event node.  By convention, they should only define relations between child event nodes and/or the node where the relation is defined. This is a silly yet illustrative example.
relations.name: patient is a member of society

events.name: Come into being
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen comes into being
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.
events.comment: If a schema event is not found in the documents or Graph G, then TA2 specifies a provenance of "n/a" and a confidence of 1.0.

events.name: Replicate
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen replicates
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Spread
events.description: Schema in which a pathogen propagates/spreads
events.ta1explanation: ta1explanations are optional in hierarchy event nodes (those with children).

relations.comment: This is a TA2 temporal relation between child events.  When a relation is taken from the KAIROS temporal relation subset, provenance is not required.
relations.name: pathogen-infect-patient is before pathogen-live-in-body

events.name: Escape
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen escapes from a body or reservoir
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.
events.comment: Union of escape (response to distress) and go (to move from a place to another that is further away)

events.name: Patient exposed to pathogen
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen infects a patient
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

temporal.comment: TA1 optionally sets minDuration and maxDuration; TA2 sets duration, confidence, and optional provenance of this object
Temporal variables can be combined into one object if they have the same confidence

events.name: The pathogen lived in the patient's body
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen lives in the body of a patient
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.
events.comment: This is clearly a bad mapping, but shows that even leaf nodes (verbs) are not constrained to the KOWG events or event pool.

events.name: Continue
events.description: Schema in which further spreading or a decrease in the prevalence of a pathogen occurs

events.name: Decrease in society
events.description: Event type in which a pathogen decreases in society
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Patient progression
events.description: Schema for the progression of a patient

relations.comment: This is a TA2 temporal relation between child events.  When a relation is taken from the KAIROS temporal relation subset, provenance is not required.
relations.name: patient-travels-to-contaminant is before patient-get-sick

events.name: The patient traveled to the location of the contaminant
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) travel to contaminated location/facility
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Contract disease
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) contract(s) disease
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: The patient gets sick
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) get(s) sick
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Diagnosis
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) get(s) diagnosed
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Treatment
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) is/are treated
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Compliance
events.description: Event type in which life pattern changes
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.
events.comment: Multiple qnodes should be specified as lists, not as "wd:Q1399332 | wd:Q67004728"

events.name: Patients get medication
events.description: Event type in which patient(s) receive(s) vaccine or other medication
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.
events.comment: vaccination (inoculation) is different from treatment with medications

values.comment: If there are two source justifications, include them in a list.  If LDC looks at provenance, it may only consider the first.
Use confidence to represent AND/OR fillers, with distinct provenance.

events.name: Continue
events.description: Schema for the continuation of an illness in patient(s), improvement or death

events.name: The patient dies
events.description: Mr. Ray Brennan died at his home three days after the convention ended of an apparent heart attack.
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Improvement
events.description: Event type in which patient's condition improves
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.description: Schema in which an epidemiologist responds to an outbreak
events.name: Epidemiologist response

children.comment: Repeatable events need to be expanded by TA2 as distinct events at instantiation time.
This is an extra-relevant that TA2 placed in the hierarchy.

relations.comment: Even though this is a temporal relation between child events involving an extra-relevant event, provenance is still not required.
relations.name: epidemiologist-educate is before epidemiologist-publish

events.name: Learn
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists learn about a disease
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Investigate
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists investigate clusters
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Announce
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists announce outbreak
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Research
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists investigate the origins and propagation of a disease
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Research
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists research vaccines and other antidotes for a disease
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.
events.comment: WD does not distinguish investigation of the origin from vaccine or treatment research

events.name: Educate
events.description: Schema in which epidemiologists carry out their educational mission

participants.comment: Just like in Phase I, multiple participants can share the same role.

events.name: Educate
events.description: Event types in which epidemiologists educate healthcare workers
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Educate
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists educate pharmaceutical manufacturers
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Educate
events.description: Event type in which epidemiologists educate government authorities
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.comment: TA2 can add extra-relevant events (found in the documents but not in the schema); use 'kairos:NULL' for ta1ref.
events.name: Publish results
events.description: Epidemiologists publish research results
events.ta1explanation: extra-relevant event

participants.comment: entity keyword for extra-relevant events can be kairos:NULL, since there is no TA1 entity.

events.name: Health worker response
events.description: Schema for the response of a health worker to a health crisis
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Authority response
events.description: Schema for the response of an authority to a health crisis
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Manufacturer DO involvement
events.description: Schema for the involvement of a pharmaceutical manufacturer in a disease outbreak
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Business response
events.description: Schema for the response of a business to a disease outbreak
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

entities.comment: TA2 adds name (human-readable handle from extraction) and extracted type/instance qnode.
entities.name: Legionella pneumophila
Ray Brennan
entities.comment: Additional qnodes/labels just show that a given person can be the patient from one schema and the attacker in another.
This just shows how a specific dosage mentioned in the text can be its own real-world entity.
entities.name: 200 mg Advil

entities.comment: In those rare cases an extracted entity has its own Wikidata entry, it should be used.
entities.name: Hippocrates

comment: This is a TA1 relation that was not found in the documents.  Set all three provenance fields to 'n/a'.
It doesn't really make sense to instantiate these equivalence relations, as it will be borne out by instantiated entities.
relations.name: pathogen from pathogen-progression schema has an equivalence relation to the pathogen in the patient-progression schema
pathogen from pathogen-progression schema has an equivalence relation to the pathogen in the epidemiologist response schema

relations.comment: This is a TA1 relation that was not found in the documents.  Set all three provenance fields to 'n/a'.
relations.name: patient from patient-progression schema has an equivalence relation to the health-worker in the healthworker-response schema

relations.comment: relation names (labels) are helpful to human assessors, but are not required at this point.
TA2 can add extra-relevant relations (found in the documents but not in the schema); use 'kairos:NULL' for ta1ref. P551 is 'residence'.
relations.name: Patient resided in location of contaminant.

comment: Temporal relations must be taken from a subset of Wikidata temporal relations (see the SDF documentation).
Note that TA2 needs to split up TA1 relations with multiple relationObjects because each one requires its own relationObject_prov.
relations.name: The pathogen progression schema overlaps other schemas in the Event Complex

relations.comment: Note that TA2 needs to split up TA1 relations with multiple relationObjects because each one requires its own relationObject_prov.
relations.name: The pathogen progression schema overlaps other schemas in the Event Complex
'Live in body' event from the pathogen-progression schema has an equivalence relation to the 'Patient gets sick' event from the patient-progression schema

instances.name: Disease outbreak (variant)
instances.comment: Not all of these schemas are implemented here. Note that 5-digit integers in IDs are independent of other instance.

events.name: Pathogen progression
events.description: Schema for the progression of a pathogen
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

events.name: Patient progression
events.description: Schema from the progression of a patient
events.ta1explanation: Justification of the event, propagated from TA1.

comment: *Text documents*
'childID' is an LDC child_id. It is the ID of the document/artifact
mediaType is an IANA Media Type.
'offset' and 'length' are in characters.
*Images*
'parentIDs' is a list of documents that are parent to 'childID.
'parentIDs' can be a list because a single image/video/etc. can be embedded in more than one parent document.
'parentIDs' is redundant since the same information is present in the LDC-provided parent_children.tab.
'boundingBox' dimensions are in pixels
For images, 'boundingBox' is required.
*Videos -- key frames*
'keyframes' is an array of LDC-supplied key frame IDs.
*Audio recordings*
'startTime' and 'endTime are in seconds.
*Videos -- time range*
'startTime' and 'endTime are in seconds.
